response.correct_answer: In fuzzy set theory, the relative cardinality of a fuzzy set A is the ratio of its scalar cardinality to the cardinality of the universal set X. The formula is: Relative Cardinality = |A| / |X|, where |A| is the sum of the membership degrees of all elements in the fuzzy set, and |X| is the total number of elements in the universal set.
